metadata.title: CVE-2020-36323 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, there is an optimization forjoining strings that can cause uninitialized bytes to be exposed (or theprogram to crash) if the borrowed string changes after its length ischecked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cargo - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
libstd-rust-1.71 - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-all - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-clippy - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-gdb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-lldb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-src - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustc - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustfmt - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2').
